program atcoder_AGC035_B

    implicit none

    type adjacency_node
        integer, allocatable :: list(:)
        integer :: nelem! count of filled in list.
    end type adjacency_node

    integer :: numNode, numEdge, i, a_in, b_in, a, b
    integer, allocatable :: visited(:), odd(:)
    character(len=20), allocatable :: printed_lines(:)
    integer :: line_count ! in main program scope.

    logical :: valid
    type(adjacency_node), allocatable :: connect(:)

    ! Read the first two numbers.

    read(*,*) numNode, numEdge

    if ( mod(numEdge,2) /=0 ) then
        write(*,*) -1
        stop
    end if

    allocate( visited(0:numNode-1), odd(0:numNode-1) )

    allocate( connect(0:numNode-1) )

    ! Read edges and build adjacency lists.

    ! First read all edges and count.

    ! temp arrays to store edges.

    integer, allocatable :: edge_list(:,:), tempcounts(0:numNode-1)

    allocate( edge_list(1:numEdge, 2) )

    tempcounts = 0

    do i=1, numEdge
        read(*,*) a_in, b_in
        a = a_in -1
        b = b_in -1
        edge_list(i,1) = a
        edge_list(i,2) = b
        tempcounts(a) = tempcounts(a) +1
        tempcounts(b) = tempcounts(b) +1
    end do

    ! Allocade the adjacency nodes.

    do i=0, numNode-1
        allocate( connect(i)%list(1:tempcounts(i)) )
        connect(i)%nelem = 0
    end do

    ! Now fill the adjacency lists with the edges.

    do i=1, numEdge
        a = edge_list(i,1)
        b = edge_list(i,2)
        ! Add b to a's list
        connect(a)%nelem = connect(a)%nelem +1
        connect(a)%list( connect(a)%nelem) = b
        ! Add a to b's list
        connect(b)%nelem = connect(b)%nelem +1
        connect(b)%list( connect(b)%nelem) = a
    end do

    ! Initialization of other variables.

    visited = 0
    odd = .false.

    ! Allocate print list.

    line_count=0

    allocate( printed_lines(1:2*numEdge ) )

    ! Call DFS.

    call dfs(0, -1)

    ! Print all lines.

    do i=1, line_count
        write(*, '(A)') trim( adjustl( printed_lines(i) ) )
    end do

    deallocate(everything ? may or may not matter in main program.)

contains

recursive subroutine dfs( crt, parent )
    integer, intent(in) :: crt, parent
    integer :: i, child, max_index, a, b
    character(len=20) :: s

    visited(crt) =1
    max_index = connect(crt)%nelem

    do i=1, max_index
        child = connect(crt)%list(i)
        if (child == parent .or. visited(child) == 1) then
            ! Skip this node
            cycle
        else if (visited(child) ==2 ) then 
            ! Edge case: back to ancestor
            a = crt +1
            b = child +1
            line_count = line_count +1
            write( printed_lines(line_count), "(I0,1X,I0)" ) a, b
            odd(crt) = .not. odd(crt)
            continue ! continue to next iteration of do loop.
        else
            ! unvisited: explore.
            call dfs( child, crt )
            if ( odd(child) ) then
                ! Output child -> crt and flip child's odd
                a = child +1
                b = crt +1
                line_count = line_count +1
                write( printed_lines(line_count), '(I0,1X,I0)') a, b
                odd(child) = .not. odd(child)
            else
                ! Output crt -> child and flip parent.
                a = crt +1
                b = child +1
                line_count = line_count +1
                write( printed_lines(line_count), '(I0,1X, I0)' ) a, b
                odd(crt) = .not. odd(crt)
            end if
        end if
    end do

    ! Mark as processed
    visited(crt) =2
 end subroutine dfs

end program atcoder_AGC035_B
